entry.title: Replay attacks make BIP148 and BIP149 untennable
entry.summary: The email exchange is regarding the issue of replay attacks and the proposed solutions to prevent it. The sender of the email, Kekcoin, argues that using "post-chainsplit coinbases from the non-148 chain" is more secure in extreme-adversarial cases such as secret-mining reorg attacks. However, the recipient, contact at taoeffect.com, expresses confusion about Kekcoin's statement that the replay threat would be rendered moot if the non-148 chain faces a large-scale reorganization. The recipient argues that without replay protection, replay is always a serious threat. The email ends with the recipient requesting not to receive any sensitive information that cannot be shared with the NSA.
